alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 24 at 2:30PM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, additional snow accumulations of up to one inch through late evening. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected with total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Locally higher amounts are possible along the Pine Ridge. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Sheridan County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 PM MST this evening. For the Blizzard Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be dangerous to nearly impossible. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, including whiteout conditions at times. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Continued blustery winds will result in blowing and drifting snow, even after falling snow tapers.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
